structure.unit: SCHOOL EMPLOYEES -- TEACHERS' RETIREMENT AND TENURE

law.catch_line: Disability retirement with less than required years of service.
law.text: Any active contributing member with less than five (5) years of Kentucky service may apply and be approved for disability retirement under KRS 161.661 if the member is found to be mentally or physically incapacitated as a result of an injury related directly to their covered employment. All conditions and restrictions specified under KRS 161.661 shall be applicable, except that the initial annual disability allowance shall be equal to fifty percent (50%) of the member's current annual contract salary and the member's last annual contract salary shall be used in lieu of the final average salary in the recalculation of the member's benefit at the expiration of the eligibility period.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 537, effective July 13, 1990. -- Created 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 363, sec. 18, effective July 1, 1988.
